Package inventoryApp

Class ModifyPartController

  • java.lang.Object
    • inventoryApp.ModifyPartController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class ModifyPartController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The controller for the ModifyPart form

      A static instance of the Inventory so that once the Part is finished being edited by the user, it can be added to the Inventory

      A field where the user can input the amount of this part being created in inventory

    • Field Detail

      • part

        public static Part part
        The Part currently being edited

      • partOriginal

        public static Part partOriginal
        A copy made of the orginal Part passed into this form for editing. PartOriginal is used to delete the old part from Inventory before we replace it with the new edited part in the case that the user decides to save.

      • idTextField

        public javafx.scene.control.TextField idTextField
        Holds the Part Id. Disabled and cannot be edited.

      • nameTextField

        public javafx.scene.control.TextField nameTextField
        A field where the user can input a name for the Part being created

      • invTextField

        public javafx.scene.control.TextField invTextField
        A field where the user can input the amount of this part being created in inventory

      • priceTextField

        public javafx.scene.control.TextField priceTextField
        A field where the user can input the price for the part being created

      • minTextField

        public javafx.scene.control.TextField minTextField
        The minimum number of the Part type being created that can be in Inventory

      • maxTextField

        public javafx.scene.control.TextField maxTextField
        The maximum number of the Part type being created that can be Inventory

      • bottomTextField

        public javafx.scene.control.TextField bottomTextField
        If the part being created is an InHousePart this text field will take a machineId to represent the ID of the machine that created the part. If it is an outSourcedPart this field will take a CompanyName to represent the company that made the part being created.

      • bottomTextFieldLabel

        public javafx.scene.control.Label bottomTextFieldLabel
        Labels the bottomTextField. Says "Machine ID" when the part being created is an InHousePart, and "Company Name" if the part

      • bottomTextFieldListener

        public javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<java.lang.String> bottomTextFieldListener
        A listener that changes based on whether the part being created is an InHousePart or an OutSourcedPart. If it is an InHousePart then the textField will only accept numbers for the machineId, If it is an outSourcedPart then the textField will accept all characters as acceptable input for the CompanyName Updates based on whether the InHousePart radio button is selected, or the outsourcedPartRadioButton is selected

      • toggleGroup

        private javafx.scene.control.ToggleGroup toggleGroup
        Toggle group that makes sure that only either inHouseRadioButton or outSourcedRadioButton can be selected

      • outsourcedRadioButton

        public javafx.scene.control.RadioButton outsourcedRadioButton

      • inHouseRadioButton

        public javafx.scene.control.RadioButton inHouseRadioButton

      • inventory

        private static Inventory inventory
        A static instance of the Inventory so that once the Part is finished being edited by the user, it can be added to the Inventory

      • setLabelToMachineID

        public void setLabelToMachineID​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Sets the Label of the bottomTextField to "Machine ID" when the inHouseRadioButton is selected
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - user clicks the InHouseRadioButton

      • setLabelToCompanyName

        public void setLabelToCompanyName​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Sets the Label of the bottomTextField to "Company Name" when the outsourcedRadioButton is selected
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - InHouseRadioButton is clicked

      • savePart

        public void savePart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Validates the data in all the text fields and creates a Part object which is then added to the Inventory, and then the program returns to the MainForm
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - user clicks the save button
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - thrown if the MainForm is not found to be loaded. RUNTIME ERROR - Before adding a try-catch block around each user input conversion, many runtime errors were encountered. By adding a try-catch block I was able to catch these conversion errors and show the user an appropriate warning

      • toMainForm

        public void toMainForm​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the program from the ModifyProductForm (the current form) the MainForm (the initial program screen that shows two tables)
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - user clicks the save or cancel button
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - thrown if the MainForm is not found to be loaded

      • setPart

        public static void setPart​(Part _part)
        A static function called from the MainForm before this form is loaded. It passes the Part object to be modified to this form before it is loaded.
        Parameters:
        _part - - new part to be set
